titles.title: Recognizing the anniversary of the eradication of smallpox and the importance of vaccination in the United States and worldwide.
Recognizing the anniversary of the eradication of smallpox and the importance of vaccination in the United States and worldwide.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

term.name: Department of Health and Human Services

bill.summary: This resolution recognizes the work of scientists in developing vaccines, encourages increased public understanding about the importance of vaccines to prevent disease, and supports funding for vaccine research and education efforts.
